intro: Hydrangea acuminata subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian smooth hydrangea, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It features large, showy inflorescences that can range in color from white to pink or blue, depending on soil pH. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to adapt to various garden conditions.
